articles.description: Follow live text updates from day two of the fourth Test between India and England in Ranchi.
articles.title: England resume on 302-7 against India in fourth Test - text updates

articles.description: Midfielder Grace Clinton scores on her debut as England put seven past Austria in a friendly match in Spain.
articles.title: Clinton scores as England put seven past Austria

articles.description: Joe Root's flawless hundred in the fourth Test against India proves that he and England can adapt their methods, writes Stephan Shemilt.
articles.title: Root rules Ranchi to show England's adaptability

articles.description: Liverpool will aim to stay on course for a quadruple in Sunday's Carabao Cup final, while Chelsea bid for their first domestic trophy in six years.
articles.title: 'We'll go for it' - Liverpool aim to complete first leg of quadruple

articles.description: Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola says Manchester United "will be back" with the help of new investor Sir Jim Ratcliffe.
articles.title: Man Utd 'will be back' - Man City boss Guardiola

articles.description: Lewis Hamilton says Mercedes have "definitely improved" but Red Bull are "clearly are out in the distance" following the final day of pre-season testing in Bahrain.
articles.title: F1 pre-season testing: Lewis Hamilton says Mercedes improved but Red Bull still clear

articles.description: Bayer Leverkusen set a new German record of 33 games unbeaten with an entertaining Bundesliga victory over Mainz.
articles.title: Leverkusen set unbeaten record and go 11 points clear

articles.description: Spain comfortably win their Women's Nations League semi-final against the Netherlands to secure Olympic qualification for the first time.
articles.title: Spain reach first Olympics with Nations League win

articles.description: Liverpool will play Sparta Prague in the Europa League last 16, while Brighton face Roma and Rangers will take on Benfica.
articles.title: Liverpool meet Sparta Prague in Europe, Brighton get Roma

articles.description: Thomas Tuchel says he does not think he is "the only problem" at Bayern Munich and believes he can afford to be "more reckless" before leaving at the end of the season.
articles.title: I'm not only problem at Bayern - departing Tuchel
